result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine Charles Cook

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antoine Charles Cook not in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Antoine Charles Cook.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pre-trial conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense advised the case remains in plea posture and requests a projected guilty plea hearing be set. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Antoine Charles Cook not in court, in custody. Appearance waived. Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Attorney Francesco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties before the court for scheduling.  Defense advises all discovery has been received. Court sets the deadline for State to provide Discovery (with the exception of crime lab report) for 8/19/2022 and sets the deadline to file any motions or any change of plea forms for 9/30/2022. The next court appearance in Br 9 will be for a continued pre trial conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Antoine Charles Cook not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advised that case might be incorrectly tabbed to Branch 4. Court finds that case is incorrectly tabbed. Parties advised that case will be reassigned to Branch 17 Judge Stark.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned in Branch 17.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Antoine Charles Cook in court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl; both appear by video.  Defendant Antoine Charles Cook in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Antoine Charles Cook not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Antoine Charles Cook in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Antoine Charles Cook in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties appeared by video conference.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
